metadata.title: Portuguese Placement Test - Fully Expanded Dual Assessment
metadata.description: Complete 180-question test with 6-7 strategic distractors for comprehension (16.7%-14.3% guess rate) and 8-10 for production (12.5%-10% guess rate)
metadata.structure: Interleaved comprehension (PT→EN) and chip-based production (EN→PT) questions for each unit

assessmentTypes.comprehension: 90 questions (odd IDs 1-179) - Portuguese to English with 6-7 strategic distractors
assessmentTypes.production: 90 questions (even IDs 2-180) - English to Portuguese with 8-10 strategic distractors

metadata.changelog: v6.3: Comprehensively expanded ALL comprehension questions to 6-7 strategic distractors to balance difficulty with production questions

phases.name: Foundation (A1)
phases.description: Absolute beginner - basic identity, present tense

phases.name: Upper-Intermediate (B2)
phases.description: Upper-intermediate - subjunctive, advanced grammar, colloquial speech

scoring.comprehensionOnly: Can understand but not produce - needs speaking/writing practice
scoring.both: True mastery - can understand AND produce
scoring.placementLogic: Last unit where BOTH comprehension AND production passed

options: Where do you live? / What do you want?

Where you live? / What you want?

Where you living? / What you wanting?

I went to a beach at three hours
I will go the beach by three o'clock

options: I expect that he spoke Portuguese
I hope that he will speak Portuguese
I wait for him to speak Portuguese
I can hope (that) he speaks Portuguese
I could hope (that) he speaks Portuguese
I should hope (that) he speaks Portuguese

questions.pt: Espero que você fale português / Espero que ele coma bem

questions.correct: I hope you speak Portuguese / I hope he eats well
options: I hope you speak Portuguese / I hope he eats well
I hope you spoke Portuguese / I hope he ate well
I expect you to speak Portuguese / I expect him to eat well
I wait for you to speak Portuguese / I wait for him to eat well
I hope you speak Portuguese / I hope he eats

I could hope you speak Portuguese / I hope he eats well

questions.pt: Se eu fosse rico, eu viajaria

options: If I were rich, I would travel
If I was rich, I traveled
When I am rich, I will travel

If I are rich, I would travel

If I could were rich, I would travel

questions.pt: Quando eu tiver tempo, vou viajar
questions.question: What does 'Quando eu tiver tempo, vou viajar' mean?
questions.correct: When I have time, I will travel
options: When I have time, I will travel
When I had time, I traveled
If I have time, I would travel
While I have time, I am traveling
I had When time, I will travel
I will have When time, I will travel
I would have When time, I will travel

questions.en: Are you going to the beach?

What function does 'então' serve in 'Então, você vai viajar?'
Complete the question:
questions.hint: Use 'então' at the beginning as a discourse marker

questions.pt: Se eu tivesse estudado mais, teria passado no exame que foi ontem. Agora, espero que eu possa tentar de novo no mês que vem.
questions.question: This sentence integrates how many different tenses/moods?
questions.correct: 5 (imperfect subjunctive, conditional, preterite, present subjunctive, present)
options: 5 (imperfect subjunctive, conditional, preterite, present subjunctive, present)

questions.en: If I could go, I would travel to Brazil next month
questions.question: Complete the sentence:
questions.template: Se eu __ ir, viajaria para o Brasil no mês que vem
